intro: Dillenia calothyrsa, commonly known as the woolly dillenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem with rough, hairy bark, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a serrated edge. Dillenia calothyrsa produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically eaten by birds and mammals, aiding in seed dispersal. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and along stream banks.
